channel.title: The V.D. epidemic
channel.description:
A series about a venereal disease epidemic in the 1960s, especially among teenagers.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: The V.D. detectives
item.description: This program features epidemiologists from San Francisco, Chicago, New York, Paris, London, and Brussels.
item.dc:creator: Westinghouse Broadcasting Company
item.dc:subject: Teenagers

item.title: The conspiracy of silence
item.description: This program features Dr. Bergen Evans; Professor Erik Barnouw, Columbia University; Tom Thiebaut; Frank Santora, New York City Department of Health; Sister Mary Lewis; Earl Lippincott of American Social Health Association
item.dc:creator: Westinghouse Broadcasting Company
item.dc:subject: Teenagers

item.title: The great almost victory
item.description: This program features Dr. Bergen Evans of Northwestern University; Dr. William Fleming, chairman of American Social Health Association's V.D. Committee; William Schwartz; and Dr. Leslie Norins.
item.dc:creator: Westinghouse Broadcasting Company
item.dc:subject: Teenagers

item.title: The V.D. problem
item.description: This program features William Schwartz and Dr. Sidney Olansky of the United States Communicable Disease Center; Tom Thiebaut of the Chicago Dept. of Health; and Dr. James Lucas.
item.dc:creator: McGraw, Walter
item.dc:subject: Teenagers

item.title: Eradication by 1972
item.description: This program features Dr. William Brown, United States Public Health Service; and Dr. Herman Hilleboe, Columbia University.
item.dc:creator: Westinghouse Broadcasting Company
item.dc:subject: Teenagers

item.title: V.D. and the schools
item.description: This program features William Schwartz, Dr. Irwin Braff, San Francisco Board of Health; Dr. Bergen Evans; Helen Henken of United Parents Association; Sister Mary Lewis; and Tom Thiebaut.
item.dc:creator: Westinghouse Broadcasting Company
item.dc:subject: Teenagers
